item.description:
This 5k run/walk is for runners, walkers, families, local non-profits & businesses to support land conservation in southeastern Massachusetts! The first 100 registrants will receive a FREE race t-shirt! Enjoy the pre & post-race Eco-Fair!

All proceeds support our efforts to save land in southeastern MA! Register to run online at Run for Conservation

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Also, please sign up here whether you are planning to run (so we'll know to cheer for you) or if you would like to volunteer. Last year, about a half dozen of us helped out at this Wildlands Trust event.

About

**We'll be featuring a special barefoot division (with barefoot and vibram fivefingers allowed).** Bayside Runner is offering 20% off vibram fivefingers to Run for Conservation barefoot division registrants who bring their registration receipt to the store (38 Long Pond Road in Plymouth) by June 8. 

This race is a member of the Bayside Runner Racing Series! For more information about the series, visit: http://www.baysiderunner.com/race-series/ 

Fees: 
$20 - Wildlands Trust Members 
$25 - Non-Members 
$20 - Team Registration (per person) 
$30 - Race Day Registration

Course 5km / 3.1 mi - **1/2 road, 1/2 trail** 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The road is paved and trail is wide, sandy (medium compaction), straight, and through a beautiful forest. There will be volunteers and police stationed throughout directing you. There will also be Wildlands Trust Run for Conservation (8 ½ x 11in) signs with arrows throughout the course.

Pre-race # pick-up Save hassle on race day! Pick up your bib # at Bayside Runner between 10am and 6pm on June 8. The store is located at 38 Long Pond Road in Plymouth, MA 02360.

T-shirts T-shirts will be distributed in order of earliest registration date to latest while supplies last.

Day-of registration and bib # pick-up 8:30am to 9am under the Charge Pond Camping Area Pavilion in DCR’s Myles Standish State Forest. (Note: Run for Conservation Headquarters are located at the Charge Pond Camping Area Pavilion, *NOT* at DCR’s Myles Standish State Forest Headquarters). Race day registration is $30. There will be no bag check, but the starting line is very close to the parking area so you can leave everything in your car.

Wildlands Trust Wildlands Trust is a 501 (c) 3 non-profit member-supported organization dedicated to conserving land and preserving the natural heritage of southeastern Massachusetts. We work to permanently protect and steward important habitats and landscapes, including woodlands and fields, ponds, coastal areas, agricultural lands, and river systems. We protect almost 6,500 acres in 33 towns. Almost 4,000 acres are in nature preserves that are open to the public for recreational activities. 
For information about becoming a Wildlands Trust member, please visit: http://www.wildlandstrust.org/SupportOurWork/BecomeaMember/tabid/182/Default.aspx

Registration Fees Non-refundable, no exceptions. Race entrants may not transfer, sell, or substitute another athlete for their registration. The event organizer has the right to shorten or cancel the event if, in his or her judgment, environmental conditions including weather or other factors become dangerous.

Volunteers / Sponsors / Vendors Volunteers: 
Many hands will be needed and we appreciate your time and help. Volunteers will receive a FREE race volunteer t-shirt!

Sponsors: 
Various sponsorship levels are available. 
Vendors: 
Would you like to display an exhibit or host an activity at our race Eco-Fair? 

E-mail skugel@wildlandstrust.org to learn more about any of the above. Race Start Time 9:30am. Check-in is from 8:30am to 9am! It takes approximately 15 minutes to get to the Race Headquarters at the Charge Pond Camping Area Pavilion from any of the Myles Standish State Forest entrances. Please see directions to the Race Headquarters below. Directions to the Run for Conservation Race Headquarters – Charge Pond Camping Area Pavilion Coming soon. Parking Parking is located in the field adjacent to the Charge Pond Pavilion. Please tell the volunteers/staff/police stationed on Charge Pond Road that you have arrived for the Run for Conservation and they will direct you into the parking area. In the spirit of conservation, please consider carpooling! Post-Race and Eco-Fair

Please stick around for awards and raffle items! Enjoy the Eco-Fair where businesses and local non-profits will have green tips and free give-aways. Also, the DCR has been kind enough to invite you to stay the afternoon by the Charge Pond beach. Bring your bathing suit, towel, and sunscreen if you’d like to cool off in the pond after the race. And/or consider visiting the Wildlands Trust Preserves adjacent to the forest, including our Halfway Pond Conservation Area or the Emery Preserve West. You can download maps of the preserves here by clicking on the red stars in the town of Plymouth: http://www.wildlandstrust.org/GoForAWalk/FindaPreserveNearYou/tabid/68/Default.aspx

You can follow the event online on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/RunForConservation

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Run for Conservation 5K-- Race or volunteer at this Wildlands Trust event
